Adjuntas, Adjuntas, Puerto Rico.name: Adjuntas
Adjuntas, Adjuntas, Puerto Rico.review_summary: The bridge is easily accessible after an easy,  half miled hike along a lush plant lined trail.  Although there are no signs to direct you to the entrance to the trail, the google map puts you at a roadside restaurant where you can park and have a bite or a drink before you enter.  Just cross the road to a slight incline which is the start of the trail.   Surprisingly, when we went on a Wednesday afternoon, the trail and the bridge were eerily deserted.  So we had the site to ouselves.   The bridge is all metal construction, even though it looks to be wooden in photos..  It is suspended with metal cables, which are worn through in some spot.  It is still sturdy enough,  with the worn spots adding to the adrenalin experience.

Aguada, Aguada, Puerto Rico.name: Aguada
Aguada, Aguada, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Honestly some of the best food we’ve ever had! This place was recommended when we were visiting Rincon a year ago, then we went back to PR recently and hit Mimosa twice, we love it so much. I highly recommend the huevos rancheros with short rib, which is about the best thing I’ve ever eaten, and the benedict on their amazing homemade bread. Their juices are also out of this world good! And their prices are incredibly reasonable, I’d be there every day if I lived close by!

Aguadilla, Aguadilla, Puerto Rico.name: Aguadilla
Aguadilla, Aguadilla, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Lots going on here. Loud music, food/drink vendors, restaurant/bar, facilities, water as calm as can be…perfect for swimming: no waves for kiddies or beginners, tons of distance for more active folks. No strong currents that I experienced. Snorkeling is good along the pier/jetty and people jumping off them into the water. I saw giant bait ball right there where you least expect near swimmers and tropical fish snacking on algae on the underwater structures. Beautiful sunset with people in the water into the night. Strong late afternoon sun, no shade along the southern side where the roped off area for swimming. Parking limited, back fill along the road.

Aguas Buenas, Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico.name: Aguas Buenas
Aguas Buenas, Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico.review_summary: I booked from 1/20-1/24 and had to live on the 20th within an hour. This place is unsafe to stay in as a retreat and you are more likely to leave the compound and spend close to $300-500 daily on Uber and Food.  The amenities do not work or are unsafe.

Añasco, Añasco, Puerto Rico.name: Anasco
Añasco, Añasco, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Great experience! Super fun with the perfect amount of challenge and silliness. Super helpful staff. Would do it again for sure!

Arecibo, Arecibo, Puerto Rico.name: Arecibo
Arecibo, Arecibo, Puerto Rico.review_summary: The Can can porkchop is something else with chimichurri sauce and the mamposteado rice thats the chef George Made was very delicious You can't miss it and the waitress and waiters services are top tier a very good place to enjoy.

Barceloneta, Barceloneta, Puerto Rico.name: Barceloneta
Barceloneta, Barceloneta, Puerto Rico.review_summary: They told us to leave the place because we were not consuming as fast as they want, they were rude with us. We felt threathened by the owners as they were disrecpectfull and a menace to us.

Bayamón, Bayamón, Puerto Rico.name: Hyatt Place Bayamon
Bayamón, Bayamón, Puerto Rico.description: Uncover the Beauty + Culture of Bayamón, Puerto Rico. Find the perfect retreat for your Caribbean adventure at Hyatt Place Bayamón. Minutes from some of Puerto Rico’s best restaurants, bars, beaches, and attractions, our centrally located hotel allows guests to explore the island’s rich culture and history with ease.
Bayamón, Bayamón, Puerto Rico.review_summary: The overall of the hotel was nice but the housekeeping is not the best. Arrived to a room that had a dirty bathroom. Visible hair on the floor and inside the tub is unacceptable. Me and my guest did our own cleaning after going to the local WM for supplies. I was expecting a cleaner room and was let down by the bathroom.

Cabo Rojo, Cabo Rojo, Puerto Rico.name: Cabo Rojo
Cabo Rojo, Cabo Rojo, Puerto Rico.review_summary: our family rented two casitas - which was perfect for 5 adults.  it's hard to put into words how welcomed and comfortable we felt during our week at 4 casitas.   the location is perfect for traveling to different beach locations.  at the end of the day - our casita provided a quiet respite.  i highly recommend this location - you won't be disappointed.

Caguas, Caguas, Puerto Rico.name: Caguas
Caguas, Caguas, Puerto Rico.review_summary:
Food was exceptional, sat inside.
Staff was warm and welcoming.
Must eat place!
We had  herself appetizer. Then the paella and the steak mufongo.
So good we took some to go for a friend.

Camuy, Camuy, Puerto Rico.name: Parque Nacional de las Cavernas del Rio Camuy
Camuy, Camuy, Puerto Rico.description: Tour some of the caves and sinkholes within this 268-acre park as you spot bats flying by and spiders crawling up and down the walls. Over 10 miles of limestone caves and underground rivers have been mapped so far, but only a small fraction of the entire network is open to the public. Wear closed shoes and get there early to secure a spot in the tour, which lasts a little more than an hour. When you’re done touring the caves, you can get a few souvenirs at the gift shop and grab a snack from a street vendor right outside. – Tripadvisor
Camuy, Camuy, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Our family has tried to visit the park on December 22, 2024. The park was closed and the guard at the closed gate told us that it has been closed for 4 months until further notice. It is not allowed to enter neither the park nor the caves. There were dozens of cars which stopped at the gate while we were there only to leave in disappointment. We were standing near the gate for more than an hour researching if there was any other way to see the caves (with some tour or by entering through a different entrance to the caves). Unfortunately, no web-site states that the park is closed and the tour pages just say that their activity is not available at this time. So, it is not communicated to the public that one cannot visit the caves at this time. This is sad since quite a lot of people are likely visiting Puerto Rico to see the caves and consider them as one of the island's main attractions, as it was in our case.

Canóvanas, Canóvanas, Puerto Rico.name: Canovanas
Canóvanas, Canóvanas, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Absolutely amazing place. My friends and I were driving around looking for somewhere to eat, we found this place and Google and decided go give it a shot and I'm happy we did because it was delicious. The mofongo, sauces, lemonade, all of it was delicious. I wish I could've taken it home with me, especially the strawberry lemonade. Our server Jeriel was so attentive and kind, he made sure everything was to our liking and gave excellent service. I actually almost forgot to write this review, it's been a few weeks since I went but the service and food were so good I had to make sure I left a review. Highly recommend.

Carolina, Carolina, Puerto Rico.name: Carolina Beach
Carolina, Carolina, Puerto Rico.description: Balneario Carolina is long stretch of white sand just east of the Isla Verde area in San Juan. It has a parking lot, restrooms, and showers. There's a kiddie water park at the eastern end of the beach.
Carolina, Carolina, Puerto Rico.review_summary:
Note:  I’m going to review the Balneario de Carolina.  It used to be called Balneario Isla Verde, so some people might still refer to it as that.  “Balneario” is a government-run beach, which is maintained, have restrooms, lifeguards, a fenced parking lot, and other facilities to make your day at the beach both pleasant and safe.  This review is not about the beach that runs in front of the fancy hotels. 

Just like the description, this beach is a long stretch of white sand just outside of San Juan, so there is plenty of room to spread out.  For a view, you can see the “skyline”  of Isla Verde to the west.  It’s very pretty. I went on a weekend and there was facilities including showers, lifeguards, bathrooms, food kiosks, and a couple of places that rented chairs and umbrellas, and water sports equipment. 

 Parking was $5.00 cash only. Just keep in mind that the parking closes at 6:00 pm sharp, so at 5:00 the municipal police will start to get the people out of the water. But, if you are looking for a nice light sand beach close to San Juan this is a good option.

Cayey, Cayey, Puerto Rico.name: Cayey
Cayey, Cayey, Puerto Rico.review_summary:
Don Juan Santos Torres is an inspiring figure, showcasing how passion and creativity can transform a lifetime of work into something extraordinary. Known as “The Flintstones of Guavate,” he turned his retirement into a vibrant new chapter, dedicating himself to crafting remarkable sculptures that reflect his artistry and cultural pride. His "sacred mountain" in Guavate, Puerto Rico, is home to his most iconic work: towering statues of the Three Wise Men, standing at an impressive 33 feet tall and visible from the Luis A. Ferré Highway.

These sculptures are not just an artistic marvel but also a testament to his devotion to preserving Puerto Rican traditions and history. By trading construction tools for his creative pursuits, Don Juan has left a legacy that will inspire future generations. 

Don Juan's work is full of cultural and personal significance, so learning more about his story would only make the experience richer. His journey from construction worker to an artist is deeply tied to his love for Puerto Rican traditions.

He reportedly began sculpting as a way to give back to his community and honor the heritage of Guavate. The Three Wise Men, or Los Tres Reyes Magos, are central figures in Puerto Rican culture, especially celebrated during Día de Reyes (Three Kings Day). By creating these monumental statues, Don Juan not only highlighted this tradition but also ensured it would have a lasting, visual presence for all who pass by.

Ceiba, Ceiba, Puerto Rico.name: Ceiba Ferry Terminal
Ceiba, Ceiba, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Probably the worst ferry experience ever. Woman was extremely rude shouting at everyone making sexual remarks regarding my clothing and saying there are no tickets when online is shows there are. 0/10 don’t recommend if you can book online the ferry is only a couple dollars and you don’t have to deal with those people. By far the worst ferry service on the planet

Coamo, Coamo, Puerto Rico.name: Coamo Thermal Hot Springs
Coamo, Coamo, Puerto Rico.description: Caters to the "health tourism" industry as visitors enjoy the soothing effects of dipping into the hot springs' mineral waters. The site features two thermal pools with access for people with disabilities, public restrooms and showers, and a food concession area.
Coamo, Coamo, Puerto Rico.review_summary: The hot springs made my body feel wonderful for a few days. I wish I had one near where I live in Illinois😃.the ride from Condado was lovely.

Corozal, Corozal, Puerto Rico.name: Corozal
Corozal, Corozal, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Eli and Nini were amazing!  So much fun and knowledgeable.  They made sure we were safe at all times and had a blast.  I loved the waterslide and eve. Did the cliff jump!  They took tons of photos and videos to share with us.  Would definitely recommend this tour to anyone wanting a smaller group experience.  We will book it again when we return to PR!

Dorado, Dorado, Puerto Rico.name: Dorado Beach, a Ritz-Carlton Reserve
Dorado, Dorado, Puerto Rico.description: A secluded sanctuary tucked away on the Puerto Rico Caribbean coast, Dorado Beach, a Ritz-Carlton Reserve is an idyllic resort where both new and timeless moments answer the desire for discovery. More spectacular than ever, the resort features luxury amenities and facilities. Our Ladies and Gentlemen are pleased to welcome guests once again at the most enchanting Puerto Rico luxury resort — one that calls to those who believe every journey should be a voyage of discovery. With its serene coastline, private residences, spa retreat and a harmonious sense of place that blends masterfully into the natural surroundings, Dorado Beach, a Ritz-Carlton Reserve is a rare resort that invites guests to arrive spellbound — and depart speechless.
Dorado, Dorado, Puerto Rico.review_summary:
This place is changing a bit, and not for the better, but it remains a happy place for me. The main pain point for me is that it's supposed to be in a Reserve, meaning a quiet place where you can feel free. Dorado is getting overdeveloped, and you can't walk or bicycle along a road for ten seconds without having a car in your way. It's worse than many residential neighborhoods back at home. They are building many more condos and thinking of building a JW Marriott hotel which will be large and probably turn the area into a circus.
Here's a list of things the hotel you used to provide that it no longer does: hammocks at the pool, snacks in the gym, foam rollers in the gym, little bottles of sunscreen, dishes by the outdoor showers in your room with amenities such as soap and shampoo. I wish they would bring back the breakfast buffet. I found that sending a pre-order through my butler helped speed up breakfast although I still had to wait 15 minutes for my food to be brought to the table. I figure it's only a matter of time before they phase out the popsicles you get upon arrival.
The Spa Botanico remains a wonderful spa but do you think that $375 for a one hour massage might be a bit steep?
I prefer the upstairs rooms because you have more privacy instead of everyone walking by and looking at you in your room. 
Amex Platinum gives you a "property credit" and you figure that you can use it at the spa or at the restaurant at Encanto beach club. You can't. The credit is only good for the 2 hotel restaurants and room service. They have a promotion giving out $500 property credits for 2 night stays and I"m wondering where anyone is supposed to spend the credits except at the two restaurants. 
All in all, a room here costs about $3,000 a night, which is about the same as a junior suite at the Cheval Blanc in Paris. That's probably a good comparison and along those lines, the price is right. What you do get here is AC in your room that works and stays on all night, fruit and treats in your room upon arrival, electricity that doesn't go out when the rest of the island does, a beautiful pool area with a heated pool and a jacuzzi with a pretty ocean view, butler service, a calm beach for swimming due to the breakers (which is very hard to find anywhere else), a good 24 hour fitness facility, a water park with 2 slides and a lazy river,  a decent gym that also makes good smoothies, bicycles, probably the best food on the island, and a gated community with very upscale living 35 minutes from an airport with lots of flights at good prices.

Fajardo, Fajardo, Puerto Rico.name: Fajardo
Fajardo, Fajardo, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Great coffees, great food, great people.  The pancake tacos were excellent.  All the potatoes (waffle and bravas) were perfectly cooked.  Highly recommend!

Florida, Florida, Puerto Rico.name: Puerto Rico
Florida, Florida, Puerto Rico.description: Puerto Rico offers the perfect balance of rum-soaked nightlife and tranquil retreat. The Spanish colonial buildings of San Juan set a perfect backdrop for a day of shopping and sightseeing. Hike the massive El Yunque rainforest to see waterfalls, stone towers, and colorful Puerto Rican wildlife. As far as beaches go, it doesn’t get better than the private sands of Isla de Vieques – particularly Mosquito Bay, where by moonlight the water glows blue-green thanks to magical microorganisms.
Florida, Florida, Puerto Rico.review_summary:
Staff super!

The rooms are sparsely furnished with no drawers, storage space, or designated toiletry areas. While it might be okay for a weekend getaway, it’s not comfortable for extended stays, as we found ourselves rummaging through our suitcases.

The fire alarm goes off frequently due to people smoking in a non-smoking area. It typically goes off after 11 p.m.

The pictures don’t accurately represent the size of the rooms and bathrooms. Everything is smaller than you’d expect.

Swimming in the ocean is not recommended at this resort because it’s rocky and has a strong undertow. There is a beach area where you can relax if you’d like.

One thing we truly enjoyed was the incredible bed and sheets.

If you rent a car, be prepared to pay $30 per day for In-N-Out privileges and there’s a valet service.

Additionally, there’s a $65 daily tourist tax that we were surprised to encounter when checking out.

The food at their restaurants was generally good.

Guánica, Guánica, Puerto Rico.name: Parador Guanica 1929
Guánica, Guánica, Puerto Rico.description: Beautiful and historic early 20th century inn located in the heart of Guanica Bay, in the Porta del Sol region of southwest Puerto Rico. Perfect getaway for couples/families looking for a relaxed time in the Caribbean or to use it as springboard to adventure as you discover all the natural and historic locations in Puerto Rico.
Guánica, Guánica, Puerto Rico.review_summary: This hotel was not fancy but was quiet, comfortable and very clean - almost too clean as the smell of the bathroom cleaners were a little overpowering and we had to open the door for some fresh air. Beautiful view and nice hotel, and plenty of parking in the lot out front.

Guayama, Guayama, Puerto Rico.name: Guayama
Guayama, Guayama, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Probably the best food we’ve had in Puerto Rico…absolutely amazing.   The Lobster Mac ‘n Cheese was incredible!  But everything was very very good, from drinks to entree!  Great atmosphere too!  And Ariana was an excellent server!  Next time want to save room for dessert. 😋

Guaynabo, Guaynabo, Puerto Rico.name: Guaynabo
Guaynabo, Guaynabo, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Nice place to visit in the Guaynabo area, good parking, good sitting area outside, and sitting area inside with air-conditioning. The food was ok, some food came out cold, it was a group so I'm guessing they tried to get it all out at the same time.

Hatillo, Hatillo, Puerto Rico.name: Hatillo
Hatillo, Hatillo, Puerto Rico.review_summary: We had issues with our GPS trying to send us down the wrong roads to get to this beach but had better luck putting Marilyn’s restaurant in Hatillo as destination and it will take you right to the parking lot. it was $3 to park for the day and guard said we could leave and come back with our ticket. The beach is great with a few little covered picnic tables and a large protected pool for swimming. There were some waves but it was safe for kids and we saw a few people snorkeling. Not a lot of shade though so plan accordingly for that. No permanent bathrooms but when we were there they had portapotty. Kind of a lot of trash in the parking area but the beach was clean.

Humacao, Humacao, Puerto Rico.name: Humacao
Humacao, Humacao, Puerto Rico.review_summary:
The hotel itself is beautiful, the staff is super friendly and always helpful. Especially Efrain was a delight, very attentive and welcoming.
However there were unfortunately some big lacks. When we entered our room it was super moisty and smelled. We didn’t get rid of that during our stay. The bed was so wet it sticked to our skin. The Hotel in general wasn’t really clean. The food was average, the tables and chairs outside were dirty from the birds and the chairs haven’t been cleaned. For some days the area outside was closed due to a sports event, which was also very unfortunate. We then had to have breakfast inside where the air conditioner freezed us :/

Isabela, Isabela, Puerto Rico.name: Royal Isabela
Isabela, Isabela, Puerto Rico.description: Royal Isabela greets guests with much more than suite accommodations. Located just steps from The Restaurant at La Casa, 20 freestanding Casitas are true "little houses" designed for the ultimate in Puerto Rican resort stays. Each Casita encompasses 1,500 square feet of indoor and outdoor space and is sited to best catch Royal Isabela's stunning ocean vistas with minimal impact to the environment. Escape to an intimate oceanfront resort on Puerto Rico’s spectacular northwest coast. Blessed with stunning Atlantic views, dramatic cliffs and a landscape lush with native flora and fauna, Royal Isabela is an epic backdrop for heartwarming family vacations, unforgettable golf getaways, romantic escapes, milestone celebrations and gracious resort living. Enjoy the natural majesty of Isabela, Puerto Rico’s from your private Casita, as you play a round on The Links, explore two miles of quiet beach, or paddleboard on the mysterious Guajataca River.
Isabela, Isabela, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Stunning location, lots to see and do without ever getting in a car.  The villas are big and comfortable, and the restaurant was great (with great views).  We took long walks on forested trails, the golf course at sunset, the beautiful beach.  A special thank you to the staff of the restaurant for being over-the-top friendly and accommodating!

Jayuya, Jayuya, Puerto Rico.name: Jayuya
Jayuya, Jayuya, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Food was authentic and absolutely delicious! We visit PR regularly and this was our best meal; the owner is the chef and his pride is evident!

Juncos, Juncos, Puerto Rico.name: Juncos
Juncos, Juncos, Puerto Rico.review_summary:
Great atmosphere, great food and great service! Far surpassed my expectations!!!
I highly recommend this experience. It was a Puerto Rican highlight!

Lajas, Lajas, Puerto Rico.name: Lajas
Lajas, Lajas, Puerto Rico.review_summary: This was SO special visiting the bio Bay! Our famile had the best time ever swimming and kayaking! We were a bit nervous about how much we could see as full moon were the day after our visit but we were not disappointed at all. The Crew on board were so pleasant.

Lares, Lares, Puerto Rico.name: Lares
Lares, Lares, Puerto Rico.review_summary: We hadn't been here for years and were delighted to find it unchanged, busy, and still with an amazing variety of flavors including unusual ones such as rice and beans.  I had soursop and dulce de leche. My husband had tamarindo and mango. On the square in Lares, not to be confused with Heladeria El Grito which also serves ice cream.  Friendly servers and they freely offer tastes before you commit to a flavor.  Many framed vintage newspaper articles on the walls about the history of Lares.

Las Piedras, Las Piedras, Puerto Rico.name: La Piedra Escrita
Las Piedras, Las Piedras, Puerto Rico.description: This place is naturally beautiful. A monumental stone with important petroglyphs allows you to get in touch with the Taino culture and its enviroment. A popular spot for bathing in the river and cooling off.
Las Piedras, Las Piedras, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Beautiful!!  The mountain roads made getting there is a bit of a challenge but well worth it!  The views are amazing.  Unless you are highly skilled with a stick shift, an automatic transmission car is recommended.

Loíza, Loíza, Puerto Rico.name: Loiza
Loíza, Loíza, Puerto Rico.review_summary:
We had a very nice experience at El Nuevo Acuario. We had excellent service which was refreshing. We had very poor service at some other restaurants.
Appetizers were wonderful. The lobster empanadas were tasty, not greasy and full of favor. Grouper bites were fried with a sweetish sauce. The  main courses were good but not great. The fried red snapper was a little over done but the skin was salty and nicely crisp. The grouper was nicely cooked and very tasty. The sides were wanting. Too much rice and slightly watery beans.
We would go again for drinks and appetizers and choose different sides with the main courses. It’s worth going for the fine service.

Luquillo, Luquillo, Puerto Rico.name: Playa Luquillo
Luquillo, Luquillo, Puerto Rico.description: Also known as Balneario La Monserrate, Luquillo Beach attracts travelers to its calm waters, gently sloping shores, and raft of watersports. The beach is framed by the verdant El Yunque National Rainforest and lined with coconut palms. A highlight here is the famous Luquillo food kiosks. Local vendors normally sell traditional Puerto Rican fritters like alcapurrias, locally-caught seafood, and inexpensive drinks made with a special ingredient: Puerto Rican rum. Facilities like showers and picnic areas can be found here too. Visit this beach on a guided tour that includes a stop at El Yunque. – Tripadvisor
Luquillo, Luquillo, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Lovely beach.  Went back for a second day after enjoying it on day 1.  A few things….. this is a public beach.  The locals are there. There is music, and there is marijuana (we were there Saturday and Sunday so maybe got the weekend crowd?). Do not expect a resort experience.  Take the bad reviews with a grain of salt.  It cost us $4 to park, $35 to rent two chairs and an umbrella for the day, and $2 per person for the bathroom/changing/shower facilities.  The bathrooms were on par with most public bathrooms at beaches in the US I have been to.  One perk was they actually had staff going through and doing spot check cleaning.  The water at the beach was lovely and calm. If you walk the 5-10 minutes to the kiosks- expect a rowdier experience.  Lots of fun food and drink options but it was dirtier (lots of garbage laying around) and louder (music blaring from cars).  The paid public parking section is the way to go.  All the vendors and employees spoke English and were super friendly!  Several food options on this end of the beach also.  Highly recommend and would go back in a heartbeat!

Manatí, Manatí, Puerto Rico.name: Hyatt Place Manati
Manatí, Manatí, Puerto Rico.description: Perfect for just a few days or extended stay, where guests enjoy modern amenities in a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. We're here to make your stay a relaxing retreat in paradise, whether on vacation or visiting colleagues. Get in touch with a Gallery Host day or night for help checking in, ordering from our 24/7 Gallery Menu, or planning a meeting. Wake up to our complimentary full American breakfast buffet. From scrambled eggs, bacon, to fresh fruit and cereals. All freshly prepared and served daily. We also offer free Wi-Fi everywhere along with remote printing and free public computers in our casual and cozy Gallery. If you want to get up and get going, grab a free pair of earbuds and head to our 24-hour Fitness Center. The Hyatt Place Manati resides in the center of a sophisticated medical district located in the developing medical tourism downtown of Manati. In less than one mile is the HealthSouth Rehabilitation Center Hospital, Doctors' Center Hospital, and Puerto Rico's only Neuroscience Institute located at the Manati Medical Center (MMC). Within 5 miles of our hotel are world leading agricultural, and pharmaceutical companies such as BASF, DuPont, Janssen, Actavis, Bristol-Myers Squibb, and Patheon. Within 5 minutes guests enjoy various breath taking Beaches and in 20 minutes you can be at Cueva Ventana one of Puerto Rico's well-known attractions. Take advantage of our shuttle service that operates Monday-Friday 7am to 6pm and Saturday-Sunday 9am to 6pm for a fee.
Manatí, Manatí, Puerto Rico.review_summary: This is a nice place, in a nice location, and reasonable priced. There are also plenty of places to eat near by. There are many things to do in the area and we enjoyed are stay. Next time we need a place to stay in the Manati area we would definitely stay here again.

Maricao, Maricao, Puerto Rico.name: Maricao
Maricao, Maricao, Puerto Rico.review_summary:
This is our review of the Forest Service Headquarters located in the Maricao Forest Preserve at the 16.1km marker on highway PR-120.
I would think this location is primarily of interest for birders, as several local endemics are present.
The entrance road turns off PR-120 and parallels it for awhile before it comes to an open area that has picnic shelters (pretty run down) and bathrooms that are locked when we were there. A gate keeps you out of the actual HQ buildings where people are working. For birding, the road in is worth walking and they've lined the road with benches for you to sit and let the birds show up.
There is parking near the bathrooms, but you can also continue up to the overlook (Banco Solitario) although there are some deep holes that make it somewhat hard to turn around. The overlook has two benches, giving you options for shade, and the view is wonderful for a picnic or rest.
Behind the bench across the road, there is a very short, straight trail that is worth birding.
The road winds up past electrical transformers and ends at a gate. You can walk past the gate and should, as it goes up to an old stone house (Casa De Piedra) in another clearing. A trail keeps going past the house and if you take the right hand path, it seems to go downhill a lot. There are nature info signs that seem new. Not knowing where this trail went (there are no maps), we were a little worried we'd have to backtrack and climb back up, but somehow magically we came out just a little below the lookout benches on the road up to them. This apparently is called the "old jeep road", and you'll notice the other end on the way up to the lookout, on your right behind a yellow gate.  Actually a nice trail.
The left hand trail I've read follows a powerline cut that goes upward and rejoins PR-120 at KM 15.3.

Maunabo, Maunabo, Puerto Rico.name: Maunabo
Maunabo, Maunabo, Puerto Rico.review_summary:
I asked our guest service rep about public beaches in the area and she recommended Playa Mario, a 25 minute drive from Palmas Del Mar.  the trip to get there was an adventure, up and down mountains on a single lane with 
sharp ess curves.  Once we hit the mountaintop, the view was breathtaking.  Even more spectacular was the fact that shared the whole beach the perhaps three other couples the whole five hours we were there.  Nice palm tree line for shade.  We were a bit disconcerted when we saw a pack of ferrel dogs running along the beach…they were playfully charging at ducks both in and out of the water.  I jumped in the car when they were getting close but they passed by without incident, even with our things sitting on the beach.  Two later came back and slept within two feet of us without coming closer nor looking for pets or food.  A great quiet afternoon.

Mayagüez, Mayagüez, Puerto Rico.name: Mayaguez
Mayagüez, Mayagüez, Puerto Rico.review_summary:
Vinum is a wonderful place to spend a night out in Mayagüez. The ambience is exceptional. The lighting and how everything is laid out makes it very intimate. They have a great selection of wines and hors d'oeuvres for pairing. Likewise, their food is extraordinary. I recommend the truffle-buttered rib eye which was cooked correctly and seasoned appropriately. Next time I will definitely try their various cocktails.

I couldn’t recommend this place more!

Morovis, Morovis, Puerto Rico.name: Morovis
Morovis, Morovis, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Great place to stop at and get a nice cold beer and something to eat. Their “tostones” are from locally harvested plantains and made to order.

Naguabo, Naguabo, Puerto Rico.name: Naguabo
Naguabo, Naguabo, Puerto Rico.review_summary: We ordered our food to take out (Monday January 27 and 3pm). It was two orders of chillo al ajillo with mofongo and one carucho al ajillo, with mofongo. To begin with the carucho was extremely soft as if it had been stewed, a horrible texture and it had almost no taste and it was thrown on top of the mofongo and when we opened up the order to eat we found an extremely oily and mixed mess. The accompanying salads in both orders had black rot ( lettuce). Oil everywhere maybe they use soybean oil, it's a lot cheaper, who knows. The chillo was a bit better but the mofongo was extremely soft, no taste and oily  The trip was only an eight minute drive back. It was a recommended place but we will not buy (spend money ) there again or recommend it. We love seafood and we know seafood.

Orocovis, Orocovis, Puerto Rico.name: Orocovis
Orocovis, Orocovis, Puerto Rico.review_summary: This was my first visit and the activity I wanted to do to celebrate my birthday. Toro Verde did not disappoint. From start to finish, it was a great time and the staff were equally amazing.

Peñuelas, Peñuelas, Puerto Rico.name: Penuelas
Peñuelas, Peñuelas, Puerto Rico.review_summary: The food here was excellent.  Even though the waiter could not speak English we were able to order lunch. The conch cocktail was fresh and very flavorful.  We had an assortment of dumplings filled with shrimp, trunkfish, octopus and conch.  All were made from fresh ingredients and were delicious.  It’s a little bit off the beaten track but worth it!

Quebradillas, Quebradillas, Puerto Rico.name: Quebradillas
Quebradillas, Quebradillas, Puerto Rico.review_summary:
The views were fabulous and that is the only thing that I can say is positive about this place. The stairs going to the beach were broke, and made no attempt to repair them. Not sure if that was a hot tub or just a pool, but the fiberglass was beyond its life expectancy and was flaking off. We had no service for our room the entire week we were there. Even after we asked the front desk to have our room clean. Unfortunately sand tracked in daily.  The doors were a struggle to get in and out of the room and bathroom, paint was peeling in the room. Room was poorly lit and needed phone light at night to see. Went to restaurant 2x for dinner, and was closed both times.  
After looking at the reviews , the rooms have been an ongoing issue for months.

Rincón, Rincón, Puerto Rico.name: Rincon Beach Resort
Rincón, Rincón, Puerto Rico.description: Nestled on the Bay of Añasco in Puerto Rico's West Coast, Rincon Beach Resort is the perfect escapade for relaxing days under the sun or enjoying an unforgettable dining experience. The West Coast of Puerto Rico, known as Porta del Sol, is home to some of the world's best beaches and surfing areas. Rincon Beach Resort features 112 newly furnished guestrooms with 24 spacious one or two-bedroom condo villas perfect for families, an infinity freeform swimming pool with Jacuzzi overlooking the Caribbean Sea, a swim up bar, lobby bar, Brasas Restaurant and Pelican Beachfront Grill. Rincon Beach Resort offers its guests an array of activities to ensure a memorable experience throughout their stay.
Rincón, Rincón, Puerto Rico.review_summary: First, great bar staff at the swim up bar and housekeeping staff very friendly. However, I have traveled worldwide for work and NEVER arrived at a hotel early to be told that your room is ready but checkin is at 4pm and I can’t give it to you before 2:30pm or it will be an $81 early checkin charge. Also, front desk lady said we could use pool early BUT did not tell us she had towels and had to go back after we got seats! Beautiful beach views!

Río Grande, Río Grande, Puerto Rico.name: Wyndham Grand Rio Mar Rainforest Beach and Golf Resort
Río Grande, Río Grande, Puerto Rico.description: Golden sands, turquoise waters, and tropical breezes abound our oceanfront resort, fresh from a multi-million dollar renovation introducing new exciting experience at our award-winning resort. Nestled between El Yunque Rainforest and a mile stretch of secluded beach, the Wyndham Grand Rio Mar Puerto Rico Golf & Beach Resort in Puerto Rico's most exotic beach, golf and spa resort. 500 magnificent acres with spectacular ocean, rainforest, and lush tropical views serve as backdrops to 400 guestrooms with private balconies and an exclusive 48,000-sq.-ft. Oceanfront Conference Center. Located on the northeast of Puerto Rico's shoreline, the Wyndham Grand Rio Mar is a haven for fun, sun and forging memorable experiences. The resort boasts two championship golf courses & tennis center, spa, fitness center, 10 restaurants & bars, a lively casino, two nature reserves, and a guest experience program that encompasses the beauty and nature of its magical surroundings. No passports or visas are required for US Citizens.
Río Grande, Río Grande, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Joel and Gabriel from the beach were super helpful and professional! Between these two, and the pina coladas at 5 o’clock bar, our stay was perfect! The beach is clean and the water is great! If you get hungry try the tripleta sandwich at the bar and grill right next to the beach entrance!

Salinas, Salinas, Puerto Rico.name: Salinas
Salinas, Salinas, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Reviews indicated that this was a great spot. We were very disappointed. Food was disappointing. So were drinks. The cost was very high for what we got. Many other restaurants would offer better food and definitely better prices.

San Germán, San Germán, Puerto Rico.name: San German
San Germán, San Germán, Puerto Rico.description: This 400-year-old fortress rises dramatically to greet seaborne visitors to the island.
San Germán, San Germán, Puerto Rico.review_summary: We had a big truck and it was extremely hard to get around downtown area. Couldn’t find parking and ended up being super frustrated and just left. Buildings looked cool but no real attractions worth it to stop

San Juan, San Juan, Puerto Rico.name: Old San Juan
San Juan, San Juan, Puerto Rico.description: This historic area in San Juan exudes old-world charm. Walk along the cobbled streets and past colorful buildings, historic fortresses, and old city walls, some of which date back to the 16th century. You might even chance upon local musicians playing some salsa or jazz tunes. There are also several museums where you can learn more about the history, art, and culture of the area, plus cool cocktail bars and restaurants for a quintessentially Puerto Rican meal. Don't miss all the best sights (and food!) on a walking tour of Old San Juan. – Tripadvisor
San Juan, San Juan, Puerto Rico.review_summary: The real value of a walk through Old San Juan is seeing the cross-section of a variety of ways of life.  You have some Spanish history mixed with almost a New Orleans' style architecture.  This is then mixed with the destruction wrought by multiple hurricanes and the lack of funds to do proper repairs.  Then add the tourist vibe, heavily emphasizing either fast food type chains, t-shirt and jewelry places, and tobacco-type shops.  Not exactly clean streets, but fascinating for people-watching.  Last, and rather sad really, you see some of the poverty that seems common amongst peoples living in warm island climates.  Not unique to the world, but perhaps to a U.S. territory.  For those who want some taste of internationalism but still want to pay for goods in USD, it's a unique place to take a stroll through.

San Sebastián, San Sebastián, Puerto Ric.name: San Sebastian
San Sebastián, San Sebastián, Puerto Ric.review_summary:
Here’s a polished version of your restaurant review with improved flow and clarity:

I just had a memorable Sunday lunch at Marisquería Jibara. The rodaballo was cooked to perfection, and the gambas, swordfish, and ahi tuna were equally outstanding—each dish offering something unique. The service by Jimmy and Berto was truly exceptional.

You don’t have to go to San Juan to enjoy a fine dining experience on par with Ariel or El Chotis. The ambiance was further elevated by the gentle strains of classical guitar and the soulful harmonies of the “trios” playing softly in the background.

A remarkable dining experience—highly recommended!

Santa Isabel, Santa Isabel, Puerto Rico.name: Santa Isabel
Santa Isabel, Santa Isabel, Puerto Rico.review_summary: What a lovely, luscious little cafe right off the main square. And it serves delicious coffee, brunch items and light lunch too. Art on the walls and a beautiful outdoor section. Try Sandra's cookies, made lovingly by her, or take some to go.

Toa Baja, Toa Baja, Puerto Rico.name: Toa Baja
Toa Baja, Toa Baja, Puerto Rico.review_summary: This beach is getting a make over, it has full time office staff now, they are taking reservations for events now. I noticed several restaurants now open near by. The water is calm and they have nice shelters. I was here during the summer and was not impressed came back in February and I was very impressed.

Trujillo Alto, Trujillo Alto, Puerto Ric.name: Trujillo Alto
Trujillo Alto, Trujillo Alto, Puerto Ric.review_summary: Great, authentic, fresh, and delicious PR food. They have everything you are craving from “pasteles”, “arroz con gandules”, “morchilla”, “guineitos”, and more.

Utuado, Utuado, Puerto Rico.name: Utuado
Utuado, Utuado, Puerto Rico.review_summary: Book this hidden gem adventure! The trip is worth the hike. Not too hard, and there is beauty the whole way. BJ was the best guide, we felt safe and informed about plants and wild life along our journey. The nature is breathtaking, the river refreshing and beautiful. The caves were amazing!!!! We look forward to trying another hike on our next trip to P.R.!

Vega Alta, Vega Alta, Puerto Rico.name: Vega Alta
Vega Alta, Vega Alta, Puerto Rico.review_summary: If you are in the area you should stop in.  This is a wonderful tribute about and by Lin-Manuel Miranda.  Staff was knowledgable and enthusiastic about all things LMM.  Website says make appointment.  No need.  Just call or email and tell them when you are comming.

Vega Baja, Vega Baja, Puerto Rico.name: Playa Vega Baja
Vega Baja, Vega Baja, Puerto Rico.review_summary: I visit my parents annually and stay for a month during the summer, and each year, we make it a point to visit this beach. The water is consistently clean and clear, and the atmosphere is enhanced by the friendly and cheerful people who frequent the area. The convenience of renting umbrellas and chairs adds to the experience, and the presence of nearby food trucks provides a variety of options for refreshments.

Vieques, Vieques, Puerto Rico.name: Vieques Island
Vieques, Vieques, Puerto Rico.description: Isla de Vieques, one of the offshore island municipalities of Puerto Rico, is located just 7 miles off the east coast. Vieques is one of the last destinations that truly remains like the Caribbean of the past: quiet, lush, uncrowded, with unmatched natural beauty. Vieques is home to Mosquito Bay, the brightest bioluminescent bay in the world, and with dozens of undeveloped beach coves, one can experience the true meaning of tropical bliss. This small Puerto Rican treasure is also home to the largest natural wildlife refuge in the Caribbean.
Vieques, Vieques, Puerto Rico.review_summary:
The views are amazing!! This is more of a getaway, secluded romantic vacation.  If you’re looking to party and the beach and what not then this is not the island to go to.  Also, since it’s an island plan to travel almost half the day to the resort!! there’s only I believe two or three taxis on the island. It takes 30 minutes to get to one side of the island and the other. But when you land at the airport, it’s an hour taxi or Uber ride to the ferry, which where you have to wait with a bunch of people who actually live there! They speak a lot of Spanish so I would suggest learning some Spanish…. Especially when you take the 30 minute ferry ride to the island then people really only speak Spanish. You run into a few Americans obviously. However, that is their language!! it’s a beautiful island. The resort I stayed at, had wild horses just walking around, an infinity pool, the horses were not mean at all. I literally have videos of me petting one, although I suggest to be careful. 
It’s about a 15 minute walk to the black sand beach. Again, I’m speaking of the resort I stayed at. And we each had our own little bungalow. I would’ve gave this hotel 10 stars or the island 10 stars but everything closes early around 3 to 4 PM and I’m talking like grocery stores. There’s not many there. They’re more like little gas stations. But they have the necessities water milk you know stuff like that. There was a few bars that were open late Ish. The normal hours to midnight or two … also like any trip make sure you book any events ahead of time! :-) as they were completely out of every single thing to do on my birthday!!! They wouldn’t even do anything so that was pretty upsetting. And that was the entire island I called.

Yabucoa, Yabucoa, Puerto Rico.name: Yabucoa
Yabucoa, Yabucoa, Puerto Rico.review_summary: We have been there several times and it has always been great until yesterday… the service was HORRIBLE. When we arrived we ordered 2 soups and some wings (both were very good). The waitress went to ask what we wanted for the main dish. When we finished the soups, we asked about the wings and she told us they were about to come out. After a loooong wait, when she only brought my main dish, I told her to forget about the wings, that we were going to wait for my husband’s main dish. Long story short: They served the table next to us before us, I finished my dish, and after about 10-15 minutes the waitress brought the wings, even though I had told her to cancel them, she didn’t listen to us. About 10 minutes later my husband’s dish arrived. The service was a DISASTER… it’s a shame that such a nice place, with young and enterprising owners, falls apart due to poor service to their customers.

Yauco, Yauco, Puerto Rico.name: Yauco
Yauco, Yauco, Puerto Rico.review_summary: You must visit! Second time and we will be back. Loved the ravioli app and our server offered the option for vegetable risotto which was out of this world! The brownie dessert with Ice cream was one of the best brownies I have ever had! Coffee and drinks were excellent as well. Tostones were cooked beautifully. And the servers were attentive and very warm and friendly. Best food for the price around!
